ms_copies_score: Prague, Národní Muzeum. Two copies: XLI.C.103 and XLII.F.478, 'Concertino no. 1...'. The presentation of the theme of the second movement is slightly different in the Prague MS.
ms_copies_parts: Stockholm, Kungl. Musik Akad. Bibl., W4-R
Venice, Bib. Marciana, It. IV. 1255 (= 11.162). Two violins parts only.
sources.first_edition: April, 1767, Paris, Vénier: Op. 1 no. 4 (for title, see No. 159)
later_editions: (c. 1775), London, Welcker: Op. 1 no. 4 (for title, see No. 159)
(c. 1803), Amsterdam, Hummel: Op. 1 no. 4 (for title, see No. 159)
(c. 1853), Paris, Boyer-Naderman: Op. 1 no. 4 (for title, see No. 159)
(c. 1853), London, Preston: Op. 1 no. 4 (for title, see No. 159)

entries.notes: Listed as Op. 2 no. 5 of 1761 ('opera grande') in Boccherini's autograph catalogue. Some MSS. copies indicate 'Andante' for movement 2. Almost all the MSS. copies indicate 'Presto' for movement 3.

partial_notes: The page shows an arrangement note: 'Of the first two movements, as part of a sonata for harpsichord (or pianoforte) and violin, by Mlle Le Jeune, c. 1785 (see No. 59).'
